meanings.definition: To pile or stack in a large amount.
meanings.sent1: She was heaping the clothes in a big pile.
meanings.sent2: The chef was heaping the vegetables onto the plate.
meanings.sent3: The kids were heaping sand to build a giant castle.
meanings.sent4: He kept heaping more work on his already full schedule.
meanings.sent5: The excitement was heaping as the concert drew closer.

meanings.sent1: There was a heaping of presents under the Christmas tree.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream sundae was topped with a heaping of whipped cream.
meanings.sent3: The heaping of toys in the store made the children's eyes widen.
meanings.sent4: Her plate was a heaping of delicious food from the buffet.
meanings.sent5: The heaping of responsibilities on his shoulders was overwhelming.
